intro: Daucus glaberrimus, commonly known as the smooth carrot, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its roots are not typically cultivated for food but are sometimes used in traditional medicine. Daucus glaberrimus thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
